Agent X intercepted an RSA-encrypted message. The public key uses blum integers. X suspects this weakness could help recover the flag: 1557056985595418190083657986292688067197821615255232768145419505655498733745616439081403523192036186564168423026470237023833116098196294975381886685007984

The flag format is flag{...}
n=4322034457816313828981094299048611598129032074747029768327316623394294267074467277896040363692711387237012201636328603012883145718940540635188369517615057, e=3427497214130893416338344368434425939928824511545617144183100582263765180107007346082354382516270990858936518588732760318542787831076417477074436002931361
The lower 104 bits of p are: 78839714112877654774770703916016370527


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{7uiatkrp}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1557056985595418190083657986292688067197821615255232768145419505655498733745616439081403523192036186564168423026470237023833116098196294975381886685007984
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=4322034457816313828981094299048611598129032074747029768327316623394294267074467277896040363692711387237012201636328603012883145718940540635188369517615057, e=3427497214130893416338344368434425939928824511545617144183100582263765180107007346082354382516270990858936518588732760318542787831076417477074436002931361
The lower 104 bits of p are: 78839714112877654774770703916016370527

extra_info: p=69974670171935154850209680259748639749044040601246855446990571452576173163359, q=61765699605251710410647260622019826890253902826915365402540344659255951254223, Ï†(n)=4322034457816313828981094299048611598129032074747029768327316623394294267074335537526263176827450530296130433169689305069454983498091009719076537393197476
